intro: Croton luzoniensis, commonly known as the Luzon croton, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its striking, palmate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in lowland to montane forest areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated as a decorative plant.
